benchmark_details.name: Grounded Language Dataset (GoLD)
benchmark_details.overview: GoLD is a multimodal dataset of common household objects described by people using either spoken or written language, enabling research on grounded language learning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that can be used for training models in grounded language acquisition and understanding natural language in robot-assisted tasks.

data.source: Images and audio descriptions collected using Amazon Mechanical Turk and Microsoft Azure Kinect.
data.size: 8250 text descriptions and 4059 speech descriptions with 207 object instances across 47 classes.
data.annotation: Manually annotated text descriptions and automatically generated speech transcriptions.

methodology.calculation: Mean Reciprocal Rank is calculated by ranking the distance of a test embedding to all embeddings of the corresponding domain.
methodology.interpretation: Higher MRR indicates better performance in aligning language and visual input.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using MRR over a holdout set.
